paragraphs.zh-tw: (Music) Thank you. Imagining a solo cello concert, one would most likely think of Johann Sebastian Bach unaccompanied cello suites.
paragraphs.en: (音樂) 謝謝 如果我請你們想像一場大提琴獨奏會 大多數人都會想到巴赫的 無伴奏大提琴組曲

paragraphs.zh-tw: As a child studying these eternal masterpieces, Bach's music would intermingle with the singing voices of Muslim prayers from the neighboring Arab village of the northern Kibbutz in Israel where I grew up. Late at night, after hours of practicing, I would listen to Janis Joplin and Billie Holiday as the sounds of tango music would be creeping from my parents' stereo.
paragraphs.en: 小時候 我鑽研這些永恆的大師傑作 巴赫的音樂總是融會 鄰近阿拉伯村莊的穆斯林頌禱聲 傳響以色列的 北吉布茨 我長大的地方 深夜 經過長時間的練習 我會聽珍妮絲•賈普林和比莉·哈樂黛的音樂 探戈的樂音從 我父母的立體音響蔓延至我的耳中

paragraphs.zh-tw: It all became music to me. I didn't hear the boundaries.
paragraphs.en: 這一切對我來說都是音樂 我沒有聽見界限

paragraphs.zh-tw: I still start every day practicing playing Bach. His music never ceases to sound fresh and surprising to me.
paragraphs.en: 我仍然每天一開始 便練習演奏巴赫 他的音樂始終 令我感覺新鮮和驚訝

paragraphs.zh-tw: But as I was moving away from the traditional classical repertoire and trying to find new ways of musical expression, I realized that with today's technological resources, there's no reason to limit what can be produced at one time from a single string instrument. The power and coherency that comes from one person hearing, perceiving and playing all the voices makes a very different experience.
paragraphs.en: 但當我逐漸遠離 傳統的經典曲目 並試圖尋找新的方式 來表達音樂 我意識到 運用今天的技術資源 我們沒有理由限制 一根樂器弦 的無限可能 那種力量以及凝聚性 來自一個人的傾聽、感受和演奏 給人的感受是不同的

paragraphs.zh-tw: The excitement of a great orchestra performance comes from the attempt to have a collective of musicians producing one unified whole concept. The excitement from using multi-tracking, the way I did in the piece you will hear next, comes from the attempt to build and create a whole universe with many diverse layers, all generated from a single source.
paragraphs.en: 交響樂團表演之所以讓人興奮 是因為一群音樂家嘗試 產生唯一 一致的概念 多軌重疊的興奮處在於 喔 你們會在我下一段演奏聽到這種呈現 它試圖 建設和創造整個宇宙 擁有許多不同層次的宇宙 而且全都來自同個源頭

paragraphs.zh-tw: My cello and my voice are layered to create this large sonic canvas. When composers write music for me, I ask them to forget what they know about the cello.
paragraphs.en: 我的大提琴和我的聲音分層 揮灑出這片巨幅的樂音畫布 當作曲家為我寫音樂 我要求他們忘記自己對大提琴的了解

paragraphs.zh-tw: I hope to arrive at new territories to discover sounds I have never heard before. I want to create endless possibilities with this cello.
paragraphs.en: 我希望能達到全新境界 發掘我從沒聽過的樂音 我想和我的大提琴 創發無限可能

paragraphs.zh-tw: I become the medium through which the music is being channeled, and in the process, when all is right, the music is transformed and so am I. (Music)
paragraphs.en: 我要成為發送音樂的媒介 而在過程中 當什麼都對了的時候 音樂便會蛻變 我也是 （音樂） （鼓掌）

title: Maya Beiser S And Her Cello S
